actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I and H. Res. 874. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on November 13, 2025.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 874 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Richard B. Cheney."

The House received a communication from the Honorable Mikie Sherrill. Ms. Sherrill submitted her resignation from the Committee on Armed Services and the Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party. The resignation was accepted without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 222

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 873, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 5371.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 873, Mr. Cole moved that the House agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 5371.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Perez notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 873.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 873 — "Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 5371) making continuing appropriations and extensions for fiscal year 2026, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the administration of the Oath of Office to the gentlewoman from Arizona, the whole number of the House is 433.

Representative-Elect Adelita S. Grijalva, Seventh District, State of Arizona, presented herself in the well of the House for the purpose of taking the Oath of Office which was administered by the Speaker of the House.

The House received a message from the Clerk. The Clerk transmitted to the House a copy of a letter received from the Honorable Adrian Fontes, Arizona Secretary of State, indicating that, at the Special Election held on September 23, 2025, the Honorable Adelita Grijalva was duly elected Representative in Congress for the Seventh Congressional District, State of Arizona.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on November 10, 2025, at 10:45 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.R. 5371 with an amendment, S. 778, S. 2296, and S. 2392.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
